docs.lead_paragraph: Americans who remain uninsured in 2016 despite having the option of buying health coverage through an Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe an average tax penalty of $969 per household.

headline.main: Americans Who Don’t Buy Health Coverage Face Heftier Fine in ’16, Analysis Finds
headline.print_headline: Americans Who Don’t Buy Health Coverage Face Heftier Fine in ’16, Analysis Finds

docs.abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation analysis finds Americans who stay uninsured in 2016 despite having choice of buying health coverage through Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe average tax penalty of $969 per household.
docs.snippet: Americans who remain uninsured in 2016 despite having the option of buying health coverage through an Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe an average tax penalty of $969 per household.

docs.lead_paragraph: After his mother died, Lamont Foxhall, who lives with depression and arthritis, recalls his mother’s voice on a recording for strength when he needs it most.

headline.main: After Losing His Mom, He Finds the Will to Move On
headline.print_headline: Grieving the Loss of His Mother and a Longtime Home

docs.abstract: Lamont Foxhall of Harlem was given assistance by Brooklyn Community Services to secure funds to help him move his mother's possessions from her apartment after her death; Brooklyn Community Services is one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
docs.snippet: After his mother died, Lamont Foxhall, who lives with depression and arthritis, recalls his mother’s voice on a recording for strength when he needs it most.

docs.lead_paragraph: Salon owners objected to a new rule requiring them to buy insurance bonds meant to protect low-paid workers from wage theft.

headline.main: New York Court Dismisses Challenge to Nail Salon Wage Protections
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Suit Over Nail Salon Rule

docs.abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Michael H Melkonian dismisses suit filed by trade groups representing Korean and Chinese nail salon owners that challenged regulations implement to protect wages of salon workers.
docs.snippet: Salon owners objected to a new rule requiring them to buy insurance bonds meant to protect low-paid workers from wage theft.

headline.main: After Breastfeeding Struggles, a Frenectomy, and Support. Which Helped More?

docs.abstract: After a frenectomy, I was able to breastfeed pain free. Yes, we still needed practice. But now the practice was getting us somewhere.
docs.snippet: After a frenectomy, I was able to breastfeed pain free. Yes, we still needed practice. But now the practice was getting us somewhere.

headline.main: Farewell, 2015 | A Year-End Special News Quiz

docs.abstract: Say goodbye to 2015 by taking our special news quiz. You can fill in the blanks with your own guesses, or choose from a scrambled list of words that were removed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unhealthy smog hovered over downtown Beijing as limits on cars, factories and construction sites kept pollution from spiking even higher Wednesday, on the second of three days of restrictions triggered by the city's first red alert for smog.

headline.main: Unhealthy Smog Hovers Over Beijing on Day 2 of Smog Alert
headline.print_headline: Unhealthy Smog Hovers Over Beijing on Day 2 of Smog Alert

docs.lead_paragraph: Family members caring for older adults struggle to balance work demands, yet paid leave is mandatory in just three states. That may be changing.

headline.main: Caregivers Sometimes Must Sacrifice Their Careers
headline.print_headline: Caregivers Sometimes Give Up One Job for Another

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age column; California, New Jersey and Rhode Island provide benefits for workers who need time off to provide care to family members; similar measures being considered by other states may help relieve financial strain incurred by those caring for ailing parents and spouses.
docs.snippet: Family members caring for older adults struggle to balance work demands, yet paid leave is mandatory in just three states. That may be changing.
